articleContent.title: Chord: 11th in F# (Shape: E)
articleContent.content:
## Chord: 11th in F# (Shape: E)

### Brief Presentation
The 11th chord in F# (played with the shape of an E chord) is a rich and colorful chord that adds depth and interest to musical compositions. This chord features the root note F#, the third note A#, the fifth note C#, the seventh note E#, and the eleventh note B. When played together, these notes create a lush and complex sound that can evoke a range of emotions and moods.

### Notes and Intervals
- Root (F#)
- Third (A#)
- Fifth (C#)
- Seventh (E#)
- Eleventh (B)

This chord is built by stacking these notes on top of each other, creating a unique and harmonically rich sound.

### Genre and Musical Flavor
The 11th chord in F# (Shape: E) is often used in jazz, funk, R&B, and soul music. It adds a sophisticated and jazzy flavor to compositions, creating a sense of depth and complexity. This chord is commonly used in more complex and advanced harmonic progressions, adding color and interest to the music.

### Songs
Here are three songs that feature the 11th chord in F# (Shape: E):
1. "Spain" by Chick Corea - This jazz fusion classic features intricate chord progressions that include the 11th chord in F#.
2. "Ain't No Sunshine" by Bill Withers - This soulful classic uses the 11th chord in F# to add depth and emotion to the song.
3. "Rock With You" by Michael Jackson - This funky pop hit incorporates the 11th chord in F# to create a smooth and groovy vibe.

These songs showcase the versatility and musicality of the 11th chord in F# (Shape: E) in various genres and styles.
